file_name: Zounds Hearing, Inc. - MANUFACTURING DESIGN MARKETING AGREEMENT.txt

perturbation.original_text: In the event Manufacturer in good faith believes that Manufacturer's Products are nonconforming under the specifications agreed to among the Parties (the "Standards"), Manufacturer shall give written notice to Subcontractor specifying in detail the nonconformity within thirty (30) days of Manufacturer's receipt of such Manufacturer's Products. Upon Manufacturer's request, Subcontractor will facilitate such Manufacturer's Products being repaired or replaced, Manufacturer must return the Manufacturer's Products to Subcontractor, transportation charges prepaid by Manufacturer, within fifteen (15) days of the end of such thirty (30) date notice period.
perturbation.changed_text: In the event Manufacturer in good faith believes that Manufacturer's Products are nonconforming under the specifications agreed to among the Parties (the "Standards"), Manufacturer shall give written notice to Subcontractor specifying in detail the nonconformity within ten (10) days of Manufacturer's receipt of such Manufacturer's Products. Upon Manufacturer's request, Subcontractor will facilitate such Manufacturer's Products being repaired or replaced, Manufacturer must return the Manufacturer's Products to Subcontractor, transportation charges prepaid by Manufacturer, within five (5) days of the end of such ten (10) date notice period.
perturbation.explanation: This change reduces the notification period for nonconforming products from 30 days to 10 days and the return period from 15 days to 5 days. This could be considered unreasonable under Arizona law, which generally implies a reasonable time for inspection and rejection of goods. A significantly shortened period may be deemed insufficient, especially for complex manufactured goods, thereby creating a legal contradiction.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Arizona Revised Statutes ยง 47-2602 and general principles of reasonableness in contract law.

perturbation.original_text: During the term hereof and for a period of five (5) years thereafter, each Party agrees not to, either directly or indirectly, for itself or on behalf of any other person, firm, partnership, corporation or other entity hire, solicit, contract for, attempt to solicit, or cause to be solicited, the employment or services of any current or previous employee of the other Party (unless a period of sixty months has elapsed from the last date that such employee was employed by such party) without the prior written consent of such other Party.
perturbation.changed_text: During the term hereof and for a period of ten (10) years thereafter, each Party agrees not to, either directly or indirectly, for itself or on behalf of any other person, firm, partnership, corporation or other entity hire, solicit, contract for, attempt to solicit, or cause to be solicited, the employment or services of any current or previous employee of the other Party (unless a period of sixty months has elapsed from the last date that such employee was employed by such party) without the prior written consent of such other Party.
perturbation.explanation: This change extends the non-solicitation period from 5 years to 10 years. While Arizona law permits non-solicitation agreements, a 10-year duration, particularly in a rapidly evolving technology field, might be considered unreasonably long and an undue restraint of trade under Arizona law, especially if it significantly hinders an employee's ability to find work.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Arizona Revised Statutes ยง 23-491 and common law principles regarding unreasonable restraints of trade.

perturbation.original_text: Notice shall be deemed effective and delivered three days after mailing if sent certified mail, return receipt requested, or when received if sent by electronic mail (e-mail), telecopy, prepaid courier, express mail or personal delivery to the intended recipient thereof at the address shown on the first page hereof with confirmation of delivery, or to such other address as either Party may specify in a written notice to the other Party pursuant hereto.
perturbation.changed_text: Notice shall be deemed effective and delivered immediately after mailing if sent certified mail, return receipt requested, or when sent by electronic mail (e-mail), telecopy, prepaid courier, express mail or personal delivery to the intended recipient thereof at the address shown on the first page hereof with confirmation of delivery, or to such other address as either Party may specify in a written notice to the other Party pursuant hereto.
perturbation.explanation: This change modifies the notice period to be 'immediately after mailing' instead of 'three days after mailing' when using certified mail. This is problematic because the sender would have no way of knowing if the package has been delivered. This is not reasonable and could cause legal implications. Three business days is an appropriate standard. The new change could be seen as a violation of standard contract law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Common law principles requiring reasonable notice and opportunity to respond.
